oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Model 1860 Staff and Field Officers Sword and scabbard
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: This Model 1860 Staff and Field Officra Sord belonged to Maj. Thomas E. Jameson, Vooheis 48th Tenn. Inf. Regt., CSA, from Maury County. The sword was used for post-war ceremonial purposes like veteran reunions. It has a brass guard and was made in Cincinnati, Ohio by Pettibone Manufacturing, a company that supplied matetials to fraternal and veteran's organizations.
